channel.title: NPR Topics: National
channel.description: NPR coverage of national news, U.S. politics, elections, business, arts, culture, health and science, and technology. Subscribe to the NPR Nation RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Texas appeals ruling that Trump-urged voting map is racial gerrymandering
item.description: A federal court in El Paso ruled that the redistricting backed by Trump and Republicans to reshape the map for the 2026 midterms was based on race, not just political advantage for the GOP.
item.content:encoded:
A federal court in El Paso ruled that the redistricting backed by Trump and Republicans to reshape the map for the 2026 midterms was based on race, not just political advantage for the GOP.

(Image credit: Eric Gay)
item.dc:creator: Blaise Gainey

item.title: Pope Leo calls out 'extremely disrespectful' treatment of migrants in the U.S.
item.description: The U.S.-born pope has spoken out several times against his native country's treatment of migrants in the U.S.
item.content:encoded:
The U.S.-born pope has spoken out several times against his native country's treatment of migrants in the U.S.

(Image credit: Gregorio Borgia)
item.dc:creator: Jason DeRose

item.title: Video evidence suggests LSU's Kyren Lacy may not have been involved in deadly crash
item.description: Louisiana state police are under scrutiny in light of new evidence in the case of a Black LSU football star who died by suicide after being charged with negligent homicide in a deadly accident.
item.content:encoded: Louisiana state police are under scrutiny in light of new evidence in the case of a Black LSU football star who died by suicide after being charged with negligent homicide in a deadly accident.
item.dc:creator: Mel Bridges

item.title: U.S. citizens caught in Trump's immigration dragnet
item.description: As President Trump expands his aggressive immigration crackdown to major cities across the country, U.S. citizens and legal permanent residents have been detained or arrested, sometimes held for days.
item.content:encoded: As President Trump expands his aggressive immigration crackdown to major cities across the country, U.S. citizens and legal permanent residents have been detained or arrested, sometimes held for days.
item.dc:creator: Adrian Florido

item.title: Trump administration shares new moves to dismantle more of the Education Department
item.description: Opponents of the changes say Congress explicitly located some of these offices inside the Education Department, and the White House cannot legally move their work without Congress' approval.
item.content:encoded:
Opponents of the changes say Congress explicitly located some of these offices inside the Education Department, and the White House cannot legally move their work without Congress' approval.

(Image credit: Stefani Reynolds)
item.dc:creator: Cory Turner

item.title: Farewell, fair penny. You are finished, but never forgotten
item.description: This tiny disc of zinc with just a smidge of copper has played an outsized role in our national (and international) discourse. The U.S. Mint ended production of the one-cent coin last week.
item.content:encoded:
This tiny disc of zinc with just a smidge of copper has played an outsized role in our national (and international) discourse. The U.S. Mint ended production of the one-cent coin last week.

(Image credit: Matthew Hatcher)
item.dc:creator: L. Carol Ritchie

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: The House will vote Tuesday on a bill to release the Epstein files, the Epstein files reveal fractures in Trump's MAGA coalition, Saudi crown prince to will visit the White House Tuesday.
item.content:encoded: The House will vote Tuesday on a bill to release the Epstein files, the Epstein files reveal fractures in Trump's MAGA coalition, Saudi crown prince to will visit the White House Tuesday.
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep

item.title: National nonprofit Lasagna Love still filling food requests despite shutdown's end
item.description: Lasagna Love, a national nonprofit that offers free lasagnas, saw requests for help jump after the pause in SNAP benefits. Despite the shutdown's end, the need for help still remains.
item.content:encoded: Lasagna Love, a national nonprofit that offers free lasagnas, saw requests for help jump after the pause in SNAP benefits. Despite the shutdown's end, the need for help still remains.
item.dc:creator: Macy Lipkin

item.title: ProPublica reporter on the high-profile raid of a Chicago apartment building
item.description: NPR's Leila Fadel speaks to ProPublica reporter Melissa Sanchez, who fact-checked the Trump administration's claims about a high-profile immigration raid in Chicago.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Leila Fadel speaks to ProPublica reporter Melissa Sanchez, who fact-checked the Trump administration's claims about a high-profile immigration raid in Chicago.
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: Rising costs and red tape force home childcare centers across the country to close
item.description: In some states, more and more home childcare centers and nursery schools are shutting down. The problem -- rising costs and mounds of red tape.
item.content:encoded: In some states, more and more home childcare centers and nursery schools are shutting down. The problem -- rising costs and mounds of red tape.
item.dc:creator: Hannah Yang
